intro: Lavauxia nuttalliana, commonly known as Nuttall's lavauxia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Lavauxia nuttalliana is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low moisture conditions.
